body:
Oh, I missed the `*args`!

The advantage to doing more than one is (1): some variables may not be traced (this occurs if someone creates a Variable during the course of tracing), but as long as *one* variable is traced, the expression participates in the trace, (2) we get to do more sanity checking in this case (because we can check that the vars are consistent.)

body_text:
Oh, I missed the *args!
The advantage to doing more than one is (1): some variables may not be traced (this occurs if someone creates a Variable during the course of tracing), but as long as one variable is traced, the expression participates in the trace, (2) we get to do more sanity checking in this case (because we can check that the vars are consistent.)
